alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 4:55PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Henry, northwestern Clay, northwestern Randolph and Quitman Counties through 530 PM EST/430 PM CST/... At 455 PM EST/355 PM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cuthbert to near Richards Crossroads. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Days Crossroads, Springvale Station, Wire Bridge, Bonapartes Retreat, Standleys Store, Otho, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Peterson Hill, Double Bridges, Moores Crossroads, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Garnersville, Coates, Bagby State Park, Thomas Mill Creek, Hatcher and Morris. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
